title: Selena Gomez shares it's the 'greatest feeling' to be over Justin Bieber
text:
Selena Gomez let down her guard on Thursday.

The former Disney star was visiting Ryan Seacrest's show in Los Angeles with two friends as she shared her feelings on her two new songs - Lose You To Love Me and Look At Her Now - that are clearly about her ex Justin Bieber.

And during their chat, the 27-year-old Instagram favorite said that she is really happy that she is not in the same place as when she wrote the song The Heart Wants What It Wants in 2014. That song was about being addicted to Bieber; her new tune Lose You To Love Me is about being free of Bieber - both videos are shot in black-and-white closeup.

Truth hurts: Selena Gomez was visiting Ryan Seacrest's show in Los Angeles with two friends as she shared her feelings on her two new songs - Lost You To Love Me and Look At Her Now - that are clearly about her ex Justin Bieber

She said The Heart Wants What It Wants is her favorite music video she has ever recorded. But she is happy to have the opposite feelings now as Lose You To Love me serves as a bookend.

'From going from there to where I am now is the greatest feeling,' she said, making it seem as if she is happy to finally be over Bieber once and for all.

The lyrics for Lose You To Love Me also make that clear as she firmly says goodbye to the Canadian crooner, who moved on to model Hailey Baldwin two months after he split from Gomez. The musician and the blonde married soon after.

Over him: She added her favorite video was The Heart Wants What It Wants, and now she gets to release Lose You To Love Me which is like a bookend. 'From going from there to where I am now is the greatest feeling,' she said, making it seem as if she is happy to finally be over Bieber once and for all

Gomez also explained why she didn't release the songs earlier.

'It’s actually perfect timing because I was going to release it two years ago and none of the words that I’m speaking would have existed.

'So taking a moment to actually feel the feelings that I’ve gone through, it’s just — I don’t know — I’m just so grateful that it’s out. It’s weird too because I wrote this song over a year ago … and it’s like I feel completely different from when I wrote it. ... It’s such an interesting feeling.

The timing is right! Gomez also explained why she didn't release the songs earlier. 'It’s actually perfect timing because I was going to release it two years ago and none of the words that I’m speaking would have existed

She had so much pain: 'So taking a moment to actually feel the feelings that I’ve gone through, it’s just — I don’t know — I’m just so grateful that it’s out. It’s weird too because I wrote this song over a year ago … and it’s like I feel completely different from when I wrote it. ... It’s such an interesting feeling,' she added

Back when they were happy: They dated again from November 2017 until March 2018. On the left they are seen in 2018 and on the right they are pictured in November 2011

'It's more beautiful for me because I know exactly where I was when I wrote it and how I felt.

'It would have been too hard to release it when it was written, now it's fun, I am smiling. It's all the feelings right? It's everything from happy to emotional to realizing it and being frustrated. I wanted to validate all those feelings.'

Ryan asks her about seeing Justin with Hailey and how difficult that must have been.

She was frustrated: 'It's more beautiful for me because I know exactly where I was when I wrote it and how I felt. 'It would have been too hard to release it when it was written, now it's fun, I am smiling. It's all the feelings right? It's everything from happy to emotional to realizing it and being frustrated. I wanted to validate all those feelings'

'I’m really grateful too because I’ve actually experienced that a million times before and that’s the unfortunate part about what I do,' she admitted.

'It’s all very real to me and I’m sure it’s just entertainment for other people; but I think I had become numb to it and it would be stupid of me if I didn’t acknowledge what I had felt because it would be inauthentic and that’s everything I claim to be and do.

'I know there are thousands of people … who have felt this feeling and it’s extremely real, and on top of the social media and everything, it doesn’t matter if you’re in my position or someone else’s because you’re always going to somehow find this negative space and that’s why I have to be careful and I just have to take steps back and just focus on what I’m doing and nobody else.'

He hurt her a ton: 'It’s all very real to me and I’m sure it’s just entertainment for other people; but I think I had become numb to it and it would be stupid of me if I didn’t acknowledge what I had felt because it would be inauthentic and that’s everything I claim to be and do,' she stated

Then this happened: Two months after Justin and Selena split, he started seeing Hailey. They wed in September 2018 and had a formal wedding earlier this month; the couple seen this month

She added she waited so long to 'express what I felt' because she wants to express 'exactly' how she felt.

'This is where it turns into art,' said the brunette.

And Gomez added that the reaction shocks her because everyone writes about something they felt and the biggest topic is love so it only makes sense that she would write about her heartbreak.

'I think that’s why I’ve waited this long to express what I’ve felt... I’m always going to be honest with people. I’ve never not been.

'I might not be overly chatty about it all the time, but this is where I’m able to release it. This is where it turns into art. …

She looked back now for a reason: She added she waited so long to 'express what I felt' because she wants to express 'exactly' how she felt. 'This is where it turns into art,' said the brunette

'It actually shocks me. Because everyone writes about something they felt … and the biggest topic is love, and, in a way, it’s not something negative. It’s actually something positive that I was able to experience that was as beautiful and ugly as it was. I think it’s beautiful I’ve been able to turn this into a new chapter.'

Lose You To Love Me is a black and white video shot on and it comes off as very 'raw,' she agreed.

The second video with all the choreography was used with several Phones taped to the walls and 'everywhere really,' she said.

The two have a very long history - they started dating in 2011.

Brave turn: Her first song is called Lose You To Love me and has a raw feel

Another good one: Her second song is called Look At Her Now at is about empowerment

She added Look At Her Now is her going into bigger and better things.

'All I know is these two songs were me wrapping up a chapter in a pretty little bow,' she stated.

And she added that the rest of the songs on the album are about how she is now and promised, 'I've saved the best for later.'

The host asked how she feels dropping these heartbreaking songs back to back; both fully acknowledge that they are about her heartbreak over Bieber.

'I think I feel a sense of relief, it's been four years since I've been working on this album,' began Selena.

Back to work: In addition to releasing new music, Selena has posed again for Puma

The day before she told E! News: 'I wrote [Lose You To Love Me] over a year ago. It's obviously a very emotional song for me.'

'It's interesting to see how far I've come from that point to now,' she added.

'Me sharing my story is exactly what I've always done. I can't be unauthentic. I can't pretend that I'm not going through something when it's obvious that I had been.'

Selena - who was involved in an on/off relationship with Justin over a number of years - hopes her fans can relate to her new single.

Retro feel: She is in white by an older home and a vintage car as she waters the plants

She shared: 'It's one of those songs where I just feel like it's out, it's released and I hope that girls and guys all over the world can feel supported. That's a feeling everyone's felt.

'That was something that I needed to do for myself regardless of what was [going to] come after.'

Meanwhile, a source recently said that Selena's single is 'obviously' about Justin.

The brunette beauty doesn't mention Justin by name in the song, but according to an insider, the track relates to the 'Love Yourself' hitmaker rather than The Weeknd, who Selena has also dated.

The source explained: 'Although the song Lose You to Love Me was co-written and a collaboration, Selena was very involved in writing and creating it, and the song is obviously about Justin.

'Her fling with The Weeknd did not inspire the song - their relationship was much more short-lived and not deep enough to inspire it.'

She has now been linked to 26-year-old Niall Horan.

Meanwhile, Selena's friend Taylor Swift called the Los You To Love Me song 'perfect' and a 'triumph.'
description: The former Disney star was visiting Ryan Seacrest's show as she shared her feelings on her songs - Lose You To Love Me and Look At Her Now - that are clearly about her ex.
